intro: Anemone narcissiflora, commonly known as the Japanese anemone, is a herbaceous perennial native to East Asia. It features showy, white to pale pink flowers that resemble daisies, with a central cluster of yellow stamens. The plant typically grows to a height of 2 to 3 feet and has palmate, lobed leaves that are deeply divided. It thrives in partial to full sun and prefers moist, well-drained soil. The flowers bloom in late summer to early autumn, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
